page.title: 18Views on the Moor.
page.content: The moor is a wild lonly place. One can walk all day and not see another soul. To some this is how it should be. However, with the greater leisure now available to the population it would seem to me to be a crime if the moor were to be put out of bounds to many people. I love the wild places, alone with the wind and the song of the birds. I is also nice to meet another human, pass the time of day, then walk on free of the cares and worries of the increasingly frenetic world. The world would be a duller place without the wild places. Although the moor has been changed by man, it seems that it remains unchanging. To all those who would stop people waling the moor, to all those who would ruin it with roads and resevoirs, I say, hands off. Leave it to the wild.
